Four-year public university tuition in 1965 cost $261 a year. Today, it is $10,440 a year.

Taxpayers paid for a trillion-dollar bailout to benefit the crooks on Wall Street.

I think we can afford to make public colleges tuition free and cancel all student debt.

My heart goes out to our fellow Americans in Puerto Rico, who suffered another earthquake this morning. It’s outrageous that Trump continues to withhold billions in aid to Puerto Rico for recent natural disasters. They need us now more than ever. https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/01/09/hit-by-devastating-earthquakes-puerto-rico-still-waiting-billions-hurricane-relief/?utm_campaign=the_energy_202&utm_medium=Email&utm_source=Newsletter&wpisrc=nl_energy202&wpmm=1

It’s why I have a plan to overhaul consumer bankruptcy rules in this country and restore the middle class. https://elizabethwarren.com/plans/bankruptcy-reform?source=soc-WB-ew-tw

Thinking of everyone in Puerto Rico right now after being hit with another earthquake this morning.

With everything the Island has already been through, we must do all that we can do to support Puerto Rico and help them rebuild.

The level of income inequality in this country is staggering—but we have the power to do something about it. My plan restructures our tax system by closing loopholes that allow the wealthiest households to avoid paying their fair share. I spent most of my career studying one simple question: Why do American families go broke? Whenever someone asked my daddy about my bankruptcy research, I noticed that he would look off and say something like “Oh, she’s special, that one,” and then move on to something else.

This campaign is about human solidarity.

Are you willing to fight for someone without health care even if you have insurance?

Are you willing to fight for immigrants even if you are native-born?

Are you willing to fight for America's children even if you have none?

Nope!

Not if you have an outrageous deductible that you cannot afford.

We are going to eliminate deductibles, premiums and co-pays with Medicare for All.

La aserción de Trump de un “peligro inminente” es la nueva aserción de “armas de destrucción masiva”: no dan evidencia para ninguna de las dos.
También creo que una mayoría Demócrata debe ser transformativa, por eso doy estratégicamente.  Me parece lo justo, ¿no?

También, yo no soy la única.

El expandir la mayoría en la Casa de Representantes es crítico, por eso regularmente (y felizmente) recaudo fondos significativos para colegas.
El DCCC dejó claro que pondrían en la lista negra a cualquier organización que ayudara a candidatos progresistas como yo.  Yo puedo decidir no financiar es tipo de exclusión.

Yo doy bastante a colegas Demócratas – hemos recaudado más de $300,000 para otros (más que mi “cuota”), con más del 50% yendo a lugares competitivos (“swing seats”). https://twitter.com/marisa_schultz/status/1215652173683531776 QT @marisa_schultz SCOOP: @AOC withholding $250,000 in "dues" from the Democratic party in protest and building her own grassroots fundraising for progressives instead
